title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [26–28? march? 1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [26–28? March? 1873]
text: dear walti got your letter tuesdayTuesday my hand is some better to day lou returned home yesterday she has been gone since last saturdaySaturday week she has had a very good time indeed thinks the visit has done her good i had a rather hard time of it i was so very lame at times i couldent shut my hand my finger were so swolnswollen but we got along and had pretty good things to eat i cooked with my left hand and edd helped me if i hadenthadn't been so dreadfulldreadful lame and my hand pained me so bad i shouldentshouldn't have minded if we could have kept house longer lou and george are very clever but i think they are a very saving couple what they want to save so much for i cantcan't see as they have no young ones but maybe its all right george is so changed in regard to being saving but i cantcan't get used to being so ecomoicaleconomical george has got a new gold wachwatch chain lou has been saving the money up to get it for a long time so she made it out with edds board money it was 46 dollarsgood bie my dear walt Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [26–28? March? 1873]
